topic: How to document WASM targets using fastapi with Python 3.12+
prompt: Write a Python 3.12+ focused, accurate explainer for: How to document WASM targets using fastapi with Python 3.12+

response_parsed.title: Documenting WebAssembly (WASM) Targets using FastAPI with Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This explainer provides a step-by-step guide on how to document WebAssembly targets when developing APIs with FastAPI and Python 3.12+.
key_points: Understanding the requirements and setup for using FastAPI with WASM
Creating a basic FastAPI application that serves WebSocket connections
Setting up the project structure and dependencies
Configuring the WASM build and deployment process
Adding documentation to your API using FastAPI's built-in docstring support

code_examples.code: pip install fastapi[all] uvicorn aiofiles websockets wasm3

version_notes: Python 3.12+ is required for this tutorial.
FastAPI v0.75.0 or higher is recommended for WASM support.
caveats: Ensure your development environment includes the necessary dependencies and tools for WebAssembly development.
Testing might require additional setup, such as a local WASM server or cloud-based solutions.
